intro: Psychotria giluwensis, commonly known as the Giluwë Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Psychotria giluwensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses among local communities.
